author: travelandtourworld.com
title: 2015 Plane Pull at ORD on September 19 - Register Today!Travelandtourworld.com
text:
2015 Plane Pull at ORD on September 19 – Register Today!
Chicagoland residents and law enforcement officials are invited to participate in a Plane Pull at O’Hare International Airport at 9 a.m. on Saturday, September 19 to benefit Special Olympics Illinois.
Participants will have a unique opportunity to face off with either a UPS Airbus A300 or United Airlines 737 aircraft. The Law Enforcement Torch Run Plane Pull is open to teams from law enforcement agencies, fire departments, private companies, high schools, colleges, fraternal groups and teams of friends and family.
Check-in begins at 7:30 a.m. Saturday, Sept. 19, at the Old Signature Ramp at O’Hare International Airport and team captains can turn in their donations and pick up their T-shirts and other materials. New teams can still sign up that morning.
Teams will be divided into three different divisions – Open Division is ideal for companies, school teams, church groups, clubs, friends and families; Public Safety Division is for law enforcement officers, firefighters, EMTs, DNR, DOC and military personnel; and the Hotel Division created by popular demand. Each team of 20 will attempt to pull the plane a distance of 12 feet, with the top finisher from each division facing off for one final pull to determine the Grand Champion. To participate, each team is asked to raise a minimum of $1,000 ($50 per person) for Special Olympics Illinois. Teams raising more will be eligible for incentive prizes at the $2,500, $4,000 and $6,000 levels.
UPS and United Airlines are Presenting Sponsors of the 2015 Law Enforcement Torch Run Plane Pull. Other sponsors are Chicago Department of Aviation, City of Chicago, HMS Host, Durham School Services, Barilla Pasta and IlliniCare Health. Because Special Olympics athletes compete free of charge, all money raised by the Plane Pull will directly assist in their training and competition.
Source:- CDA
